remarks: ` ( P - 1 ) ` factorial divides the ` N ` -th derivative of ` F ` applied to ` J ` .  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
statement:
etransclem37.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
etransclem37.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) |`t S ) ) $.
etransclem37.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. NN ) $.
etransclem37.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN0 ) $.
etransclem37.f $e |- F = ( x e. X |-> ( ( x ^ ( P - 1 ) ) x. prod_ j e. ( 1 ... M ) ( ( x - j ) ^ P ) ) ) $.
etransclem37.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
etransclem37.h $e |- H = ( j e. ( 0 ... M ) |-> ( x e. X |-> ( ( x - j ) ^ if ( j = 0 , ( P - 1 ) , P ) ) ) ) $.
etransclem37.c $e |- C = ( n e. NN0 |-> { c e. ( ( 0 ... n ) ^m ( 0 ... M ) ) | sum_ j e. ( 0 ... M ) ( c ` j ) = n } ) $.
etransclem37.9 $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( 0 ... M ) ) $.
etransclem37.j $e |- ( ph -> J e. X ) $.
etransclem37 $p |- ( ph -> ( ! ` ( P - 1 ) ) || ( ( ( S Dn F ) ` N ) ` J ) ) $.
